idcexport Module¶

creates a dataset from the IDC database Usage: python idcexport.py <connect-string> <label> <start-time> <end-time> <data.tar>

The various tables in the dataset are o. README.txt

A text summary of the dataset.
  1. dataset.csv
  • label
  • start_time
  • end_time
  1. site.csv
  • sta
  • lon
  • lat
  • elev
  • isarray
  1. phase.csv
  • phase
  • istimedef
  1. idcx_arrival.csv & leb_arrival.csv
  • sta
  • arid
  • time
  • deltime
  • azimuth
  • delaz
  • slo
  • delslo
  • SNR
  • iphase
  • amplitude
  • period
  1. leb_assoc.csv & sel3_assoc.csv
  • orid
  • arid
  • phase
  • sta
  1. leb_origin.csv & sel3_origin.csv
  • lon
  • lat
  • depth
  • time
  • mb
  • orid

Example:

To extract the Tohoku seismic data from vDEC:

March 11 to March 13 2012 > python idcexport.py nimar/nimar@irdb tohoku-test 1299801600 1299974400 tohoku-test.tar –schemasuffix “_ref.”

Dec 1 2010 to March 11 2012 > python idcexport.py nimar/nimar@irdb tohoku-train 1291161600 1299801600 tohoku-train.tar –schemasuffix “_ref.”

sigvisa.idcexport.export_query(cursor, query, tar, destfile, filterconds=None, returnrows=False)[source]¶
sigvisa.idcexport.main()[source]¶
